title.rendered: BCCI announces cash rewards for the groundsmen and curators at all IPL venues.

content.rendered:
The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Jay on Monday announced the cash prizes for the stewards and officials of all 10 sports venues and three other venues.

The 10th venue of the All India Premier League (IPL) and the other three venues are Dr YS Rajshekar Reddy ACA-VDCA International Cricket Stadium in Visakhapatnam, where Delhi Capitals played their first three matches at home, Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamshala. , where the Punjab Royals play their last two home matches at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati, which became the home of the Rajasthan Royals at the end of the tournament. “The unsung heroes of our successful T20 season are the amazing groundsmen who work hard to deliver impressive performances even in difficult weather conditions,” BCCI secretary Shah wrote in X.

“As a token of appreciation, fielders and caretakers at 10 regular IPL venues will get INR 25 lakhs each, while teams at 3 other venues will get INR 10 lakhs each. Thank you for your dedication and hard work.

The two competitions are two years in Sunday Knordden Knorden who is defeating the name of his third winter of the stars.

ReadAlso: Ricky Ponting refuses to accept BCCI’s offer to coach Team India
